title: MC slopes upward because MP is decreasing

content.question: If labor is the only variable input in the production process, the short-run marginal cost curve is upward sloping because which of the following occurs as more and more labor is added?

choices.label: Output decreases, and thus marginal cost increases.
Output increases, and thus marginal cost increases.
Output increases at an increasing rate, and thus the cost of producing each additional unit of output increases.
Output increases at a decreasing rate, and thus the cost of producing each additional unit of output increases.
Output increases at a decreasing rate, and thus the cost of producing each additional unit of output decreases.

content.answer: Output increases at a decreasing rate, and thus the cost of producing each additional unit of output increases.
